Question_1.Context: The study investigated the effect of co-presence of microplastics and chemical contaminants in soil on lettuce growth and chemical uptake.
Question_1.Question: What was the effect of the presence of only cadmium (Cd) or procymidone (PCM) on lettuce leaf lengths?
Question_1.C: Not affected by Cd or PCM
Question_1.Source: The lettuce leaf lengths were not affected by the presence of only Cd or PCM.

Question_2.Context: The study examined the impact of microplastics on lettuce growth in soil.
Question_2.Question: What was the impact of low-density polyethylene (LDPE) or polyvinyl chloride (PVC) in soil on lettuce growth?
Question_2.Source: The presence of only LDPE or PVC in soil at the concentrations used in this study did not have significant impacts on the lettuce growth.

Question_3.Context: The study explored the combined effect of microplastics and chemical contaminants on lettuce growth.
Question_3.Question: How did the co-presence of cadmium (Cd) and low-density polyethylene (LDPE) affect lettuce leaf numbers?
Question_3.Source: The changes in the number of lettuce leaves with time in the Cd-contaminated soils with LDPE were negligible.

Question_4.Context: The study analyzed the absorption of chemicals by lettuce in different soil samples.
Question_4.Question: How did the absorption of cadmium (Cd) by lettuce change in the presence of microplastics?
Question_4.Source: The Cd absorption by lettuce was similar regardless of the types of microplastics.

Question_5.Context: The study focused on the absorption of chemicals by lettuce in contaminated soil.
Question_5.Question: What was the effect of procymidone (PCM) contamination on lettuce leaf lengths?
Question_5.Source: The leaf length was increased with time after the initial stagnation time regardless of the presence of microplastics.

Question_6.Context: The study investigated the impact of microplastics on lettuce growth in different soil samples.
Question_6.Question: How did the presence of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) affect lettuce leaf numbers in procymidone (PCM)-contaminated soil?
Question_6.Source: The lettuce leaf numbers did not change with time in the presence of PVC or LDPE in the PCM-contaminated soil.

Question_7.Context: The study examined the absorption of chemicals by lettuce in different soil samples.
Question_7.Question: How did the absorption of procymidone (PCM) by lettuce change in the presence of microplastics?
Question_7.Source: The PCM absorbed by the lettuce in the PCM-contaminated soil was significantly higher than that in the control soil.

Question_8.Context: The study focused on the impact of chemical contaminants and microplastics on lettuce growth.
Question_8.Question: What was the effect of the co-presence of cadmium (Cd) and polyvinyl chloride (PVC) on lettuce leaf lengths?
Question_8.Source: The leaf length was increased with time after the initial stagnation period, except for the Cd-contaminated soil with PVC.

Question_9.Context: The study investigated the absorption of chemicals by lettuce in different soil samples.
Question_9.Question: How did the absorption of cadmium (Cd) by lettuce change in the presence of low-density polyethylene (LDPE)?
Question_9.Source: The Cd absorbed by the lettuce in the control soils was 17 µg g−1, on average, and it was increased significantly in the Cd-contaminated soil.

Question_10.Context: The study examined the impact of chemical contaminants and microplastics on lettuce growth.
Question_10.Question: What was the effect of the co-presence of procymidone (PCM) and low-density polyethylene (LDPE) on lettuce leaf numbers?
Question_10.Source: The lettuce leaf numbers did not change with time in the presence of PVC or LDPE in the PCM-contaminated soil.
